title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: vignette provides detailed walkthrough use TeenGrowth package forecast visualize BMI data. guide cover data cleaning, BMI forecasting, plotting results. TeenGrowth R package designed use eating disorder researchers familiarity R interested forecasting BMI data. interested clinical applications package app, please refer TeenGrowth Shiny app.

title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: first step clean data using clean_data function. function prepares data standardizing column names units.
code: clean_data = clean_data(demo,                         id_col_name = 'participant',                          age_col_name = 'age',                         sex_col_name = 'sex',                         ht_col_name = 'height',                         wt_col_name = 'weight',                         adult_ht_col_name = 'adult_height_in',                          ed_aoo_col_name = 'ed_aoo',                          ht_unit = 'in',                          wt_unit = 'lb')

title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: Next, generate BMI forecasts using forecast_bmi function. function calculates future BMI values based provided data. following example, use mean BMIz prior eating disorder onset central value prediction, 95% prediction interval.
code: BMI_forecast <- forecast_bmi(              data = clean_data,               central_value = "mean",              ci = 95)

title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: can now visualize cleaned data BMI forecasts. plot_eBMI function used plot estimated BMI data, plot_weight function plots weight data.
code: plot_eBMI(clean_data = clean_data,            forecast_data = BMI_forecast,            px = 2) plot_weight(clean_data = clean_data,            forecast_data = BMI_forecast,            px = 2)

title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: additional function, clean_forecast_data allows creation table organizes 10-year forecast data (6-month age intervals) expected BMI Weight
code: forecast_data <- clean_forecast_data(BMI_forecast,                      px = 2,                      model = 'mean') knitr::kable(forecast_data)

title: TeenGrowth Vignette
text: Finally, provide example use package treatment planning. case, specific participant identified, data prepared plotting tx_plot_clean, weight restoration plot able derived using Wt_Restore_Plot function.
code: wt_restore <- demo |> filter(participant == 2) wt_restore_clean <-     tx_plot_clean(wt_restore,                         age_col_name = 'age',                         age_unit = 'years',                         ht_col_name = 'height',                         wt_col_name = 'weight',                         adult_ht = wt_restore$adult_height_in[1],                         ht_unit = 'in',                          wt_unit = 'lb',                          dob = '2009-01-01',                          tx_start_date = '2024-01-01')     wt_restore_forecast <- BMI_forecast |> filter (id == 2)     Wt_Restore_Plot(wt_restore_clean,                  wt_restore_forecast,                  slope_per_week = 0.5)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Katherine Schaumberg. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schaumberg K (2024). TeenGrowth: Predicition Body Mass Index Weight Adolescent Development. R package version 0.1.0, https://embark-lab.github.io/TeenGrowth/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TeenGrowth: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development},   author = {Katherine Schaumberg},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://embark-lab.github.io/TeenGrowth/}, }

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: TeenGrowth package includes functions : Cleaning processing growth data. Calculating Body Mass Index (BMI) BMI z-scores (BMIZ). Forecasting growth metrics. Visualizing growth data weight restoration plans.

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: install package using `install_github` function: use following code:
code: devtools::install.packages("remotes") library(remotes) install_github("embark-lab/embarktools") install_github("embark-lab/TeenGrowth")

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: brief example use  TeenGrowth package: detailed outline use R package, refer package vignette.
code: # Load the package library(TeenGrowth)  # Example data data <- read.csv("path/to/your/data.csv")  # Clean the data cleaned_data <- clean_raw_data(data)  # Forecast BMI bmi_forecast <- forecast_bmi(clean_data)  # Plot the results of participant # 1 plot_eBMI(clean_data = cleaned_data, forecast_data = bmi_forecast, px = 1)

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: clinical application,  TeenGrowth package includes Shiny application provide interactive interface data input, model selection, weight restoration planning.

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: Shiny application structured several tabs: Data Input: Upload data file (CSV Excel) use provided demo data. Data Specification: Map data columns required fields. Model Selection: Select model run data view predictions. Weight Restoration Planning: Plan weight restoration strategy based predictions. Background FAQ: Provides additional information usage instructions.

what: Example Workflow in the Shiny App
title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: Data Input: Upload data select demo data. Data Specification: Specify columns corresponding required fields. Model Selection: Select model generate predictions. Weight Restoration Planning: Input relevant parameters visualize restoration plan.

title: Predicition of Body Mass Index and Weight Through Adolescent Development
text: welcome contributions community. suggestions, bug reports, feature requests, please open issue submit pull request GitHub.

what: Add BMI to Data Frame — add_bmi
title: Add BMI to Data Frame — add_bmi
text: function adds BMI column data frame based age, sex, normalized BMI (BMI percentile BMI z-score).

title: Add BMI to Data Frame — add_bmi
code: add_bmi(   data,   age,   normed_bmi,   data_source = "cdc",   type = "bmiz",   sex = 2,   dob = NULL,   date_assessed = NULL,   age_unit = NULL )

title: Add BMI to Data Frame — add_bmi
text: data data frame containing necessary columns. age column data representing age individuals. normed_bmi column data representing normalized BMI (either BMI percentile BMI z-score). data_source string specifying data source, either 'cdc' 'wgsr'. Default 'cdc'. type string specifying type normalized BMI, either 'bmiz' BMI z-score 'pct' BMI percentile. Default 'bmiz'. sex column data representing sex individuals, 1 = Male 2 = Female. Default 2 (Female). dob (Optional) column data representing date birth. date_assessed (Optional) column data representing date assessment. age_unit (Optional) string specifying unit age column.

title: Add BMI to Data Frame — add_bmi
text: data frame added BMI column.

what: Calculate BMI-Z scores for a dataset. — add_bmiz
title: Calculate BMI-Z scores for a dataset. — add_bmiz
text: function takes dataset calculates BMI-Z scores.

title: Calculate BMI-Z scores for a dataset. — add_bmiz
code: add_bmiz(   data,   wt = NULL,   ht = NULL,   age,   bmi = NULL,   wt_units = "kg",   data_source = "cdc",   ht_units = "cm",   sex = 2,   dob = NULL,   date_assessed = NULL )

title: Calculate BMI-Z scores for a dataset. — add_bmiz
text: data data frame containing weight, height, age, sex information. wt vector representing weight (optional). ht vector representing height (optional). age vector representing age. bmi vector representing BMI (optional). wt_units vector weight units ('kg' 'lb'). data_source Data source ('cdc' 'wgsr') - Default 'cdc' ht_units vector height units ('cm', 'm', '', 'ft'). sex vector representing sex (default set 2 = female). dob Date birth (optional). date_assessed Date assessment (optional).

title: Calculate BMI-Z scores for a dataset. — add_bmiz
text: data frame BMI-Z scores added 'bmiz' column.

what: Clean BMI data This function intakes raw data and creates columns for id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, and BMIZ. It handles various formats for sex and height/weight units, calculates age in months, and manages missing columns. — clean_data
title: Clean BMI data This function intakes raw data and creates columns for id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, and BMIZ. It handles various formats for sex and height/weight units, calculates age in months, and manages missing columns. — clean_data
text: Clean BMI data function intakes raw data creates columns id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, BMIZ. handles various formats sex height/weight units, calculates age months, manages missing columns.

title: Clean BMI data This function intakes raw data and creates columns for id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, and BMIZ. It handles various formats for sex and height/weight units, calculates age in months, and manages missing columns. — clean_data
code: clean_data(   data,   id_col_name = NULL,   age_col_name = NULL,   dob_col_name = NULL,   date_assessed_col_name = NULL,   age_unit = NULL,   sex_col_name = NULL,   ht_col_name = NULL,   ht_unit = "cm",   wt_col_name = NULL,   wt_unit = "kg",   bmi_col_name = NULL,   bmiz_col_name = NULL,   pct_col_name = NULL,   data_source = "cdc",   adult_ht_col_name = NULL,   age_adult_ht_col_name = NULL,   ed_aoo_col_name = NULL )

title: Clean BMI data This function intakes raw data and creates columns for id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, and BMIZ. It handles various formats for sex and height/weight units, calculates age in months, and manages missing columns. — clean_data
text: data data frame containing raw data. id_col_name name column containing unique identifiers. Defaults NULL. age_col_name name column containing age values. Defaults NULL. dob_col_name name column containing date birth. Defaults NULL. date_assessed_col_name name column containing date assessment. Defaults NULL. age_unit unit age values ('days', 'months', 'years'). Defaults NULL. sex_col_name name column containing sex values. Defaults NULL. ht_col_name name column containing height values. Defaults NULL. ht_unit unit height values ('cm' 'inches'). Defaults 'cm'. wt_col_name name column containing weight values. Defaults NULL. wt_unit unit weight values ('kg' 'lbs'). Defaults 'kg'. bmi_col_name name column containing BMI values. Defaults NULL. bmiz_col_name name column containing BMIZ values. Defaults NULL. pct_col_name name column containing percentile values. Defaults NULL. data_source source data ('cdc' ). Defaults 'cdc'. adult_ht_col_name name column containing adult height values. Defaults NULL. age_adult_ht_col_name name column containing age adult height values. Defaults NULL. ed_aoo_col_name name column containing age onset puberty values. Defaults NULL.

title: Clean BMI data This function intakes raw data and creates columns for id, agemos, sex, adult height, BMI, and BMIZ. It handles various formats for sex and height/weight units, calculates age in months, and manages missing columns. — clean_data

title: Clean Treatment Data — tx_plot_clean
text: filtered_data data frame containing filtered data single participant. age_col_name name column containing age participant date_assessed_col_name name column containing date data assessed ht_col_name name column containing height participant wt_col_name name column containing weight participant age_unit unit age column (e.g., years, months, days) ht_unit unit height column (e.g., cm, ) wt_unit unit weight column (e.g., kg, lb) bmi_col_name name column containing BMI participant bmiz_col_name name column containing BMI z-score participant pct_col_name name column containing percentile participant data_source source data (e.g., cdc, ) dob date birth participant sex Sex current_ht current height participant age_current_ht age current height measured adult_ht adult height participant age_adult_ht age adult height measured ed_aoo age onset eating disorder tx_start_date start date treatment intake_wt intake weight participant
